policies.involuntary_refund:
:
• Check disruption policy via FQN in GDS.
• No waiver code required if 'UN' status applies.
• Refunds are normally issued in the form of a Voucher unless otherwise required by law.
• Vouchers are non-transferable, valid only for the named passenger, and redeemable via website, mobile app, or call center.
• Refunds exclude credit card charges and optional extras unless refunded involuntarily.
• If you miss your flight without prior notice, the fare is non-refundable unless laws dictate otherwise.
• Refunds due to cancellations or delays >3h may be offered as a full voucher or free rebooking.
• For group bookings, contact groupreservations@flydubai.com for refund terms.
• Refunds must be requested by original payer with proper identification; third-party refund requests require notarized authorization.
policies.involuntary_reissue:
• All reissue requests must be handled manually.
• Use GDS FQN to verify fare change/refund eligibility.
• Involuntary reissues from FZ-141 HQ must be initiated by the agent and CC'ed to Head Office.
• Schedule changes >3h may be eligible for free rebooking.
• Passenger may cancel flight for a voucher refund if significant time/airport change occurs.
• Date/sector changes must occur more than 4 hours before departure.
• Once checked in, voluntary changes or cancellations are not allowed.
policies.voluntary_refund:
Flydubai’s voluntary refund policy is governed by the fare rules associated with the ticket. Some fares may be partially refundable while others are strictly non-refundable. Refunds, when permitted, are generally issued in the form of a Voucher, unless applicable law requires reimbursement to the original form of payment. All refund requests must be submitted within the ticket’s validity period, and any deductions (e.g., service fees, used segments) will apply according to the fare conditions.

Tickets purchased through GDS must be refunded via the same GDS, and refunds on tickets with Flydubai-issued waivers must include the remark 'Approved by FZ'. Government-imposed taxes (e.g., YQ/YR) are typically non-refundable. Tickets issued by travel agents must be refunded by the issuing agent.

In situations involving force majeure (e.g., unexpected security surcharges, major global events, or operational emergencies), Flydubai reserves the right to apply post-ticketing surcharges. If a passenger chooses not to travel due to these added costs, they may cancel their booking and receive a refund in the form of a Voucher. Refunds to the original form of payment are only provided if legally required.
policies.medical_refund:
• No general waiver code system in place.
• Involuntary refunds allowed without waiver if flight has 'UN' status.
• Manual review of escalations submitted with justification.
• Exceptional circumstance surcharges may apply; passengers may cancel for a voucher in such cases.
• No fee waivers for no-shows or last-minute cancellations unless required by law.
policies.name_change:
• Name changes are not permitted.
• Name corrections not publicly published—must be submitted with justification.
• Escalations for name issues must go through manual approval with documentation.
• Booking confirmations are non-transferable.
policies.group_booking:
• Group booking: 10+ passengers.
• Max group size: 50 passengers.
• Must be booked via groupreservations@flydubai.com.
• School group conditions:
  → 1 escort (18+) per 10 minors (8+ years only).
  → No exit row seating for children/escorts.
  → Escorts must sit in aisle seats.
  → Escorts responsible during disruptions/diversions.
• All communication and payment through primary contract holder.
• Group bookings are subject to custom conditions and not eligible for online management tools.
policies.infant_policy:
• Infants <7 days old are not permitted.
• Infants (7 days–2 years): Must share adult’s seat or sit in approved car-type seat (extra seat must be purchased).
• 2 infants per adult allowed (1 on lap, 1 in car-type seat).
• Infant must not be seated in emergency row.
• Infant seat must be approved for aviation use.
• No unaccompanied minor service provided; children <12 must travel with someone ≥16.
policies.baggage_policy:
• Cabin: 1 bag free; size/weight limits apply.
• Checked baggage must be pre-purchased or paid at airport (strictly limited by weight/space).
• Max 3 checked bags; 32kg each, 165cm combined dimensions.
• Special items (musical instruments, sports gear) subject to prior approval and fees.
• Prohibited in checked baggage: valuables, electronics, medications, documents.
• Prohibited in hand baggage: weapons, sharp objects, large liquids (>100ml unless exempt).
• Firearms: require 4 business days advance approval and full documentation.
• Mobility aids for disabled passengers allowed (max 2, must notify airline in advance).
policies.seat_request_policy:
• Prepaid seat selection not guaranteed.
• Airline may change seat for operational, safety, or legal reasons.
• If reassigned, prepaid seat fees will be refunded.
• Oversized hand baggage may require last-minute fee and check-in at gate.
• Exit row seating unavailable to children, escorts, or mobility-limited passengers.
policies.short_term_cancellation_policy:
• Free cancellation permitted within 24 hours of booking *if* departure is at least 7 days away.
• Cancellations within 24 hours of booking but within 7 days of departure may incur fees; refund may be issued as voucher.
• Duplicate bookings may be eligible for manual voucher refund within 24 hours if submitted with proof of full payment.
• Voluntary voids follow fare rules and are processed manually.
• No refund or voucher is provided if the passenger fails to notify airline prior to departure or check-in.

support_contacts._note: For internal use only. Do not include in autoresponse emails.
